abstract: Jon Caramanica Critic’s Notebook observes that 10th annual Pitchfork Music Festival featured a polyglot music lineup that drew listeners to other genres, blurred artistic barriers and expanded mind-sets to create new mainstream sound.
lead_paragraph: The festival, in its 10th year, was dominated by guitar-driven rock on Friday, a mixed bag of styles on Saturday and hip-hop and electronic music on Sunday.

headline.main: Pitchfork Music Festival in Chicago Welcomes a Polyglot of Styles
headline.print_headline: A Polyglot of Styles at Pitchfork

snippet: The festival, in its 10th year, was dominated by guitar-driven rock on Friday, a mixed bag of styles on Saturday and hip-hop and electronic music on Sunday.
